thread.title: The Most Overhyped AI Startups That Failed in 2024 - Towards AI
thread.title_full: The Most Overhyped AI Startups That Failed in 2024 - Towards AI

author: Mélony Qin (aka cloudmelon)
title: The Most Overhyped AI Startups That Failed in 2024 - Towards AI
text:
The Most Overhyped AI Startups That Failed in 2024
Did you know that about 90% of [AI startups](https://cvisiona.com/deep-dive-state-of-ai-startup/) fail? Some AI startups have created a lot of buzz in recent years but eventually came to an end. It’s important not to get too caught up in the AI excitement. Instead, let’s take a closer look at what causes these overhyped AI startups to fail. Having been on this journey myself for about 1.5 years, I would like to share what I have learned in this post. So, let’s dive in and find out.
Failure 1 — The Rise and Fall of Utrip: AI-Powered Travel Planning
[Utrip is an AI-powered travel planning app](https://youtu.be/FC0ykQpEQ74) that provides travel and sightseeing recommendations to see and do after collecting a few basic facts about a traveler. Their targeted users include regular travelers, but it is also exposed to a larger audience by providing a higher-end product called Utrip PRO. Well, It is not like an upgrade from iPad to iPad Pro, though. Utrip Pro is for hotels, agencies, and DMOs — Destination Marketing Organizations, including tourist boards, tourism authorities, or visitor bureaus.
They gathered millions of traveler information in the first few years of launch. As a new startup founded in 2012, they secured [a total of $6 million in funding through 4 rounds](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/utrip). Investors included Acorn Ventures, Tiempo Capital, and even executives from Apple and…
